column5: Hey guys,  I've found myself knee-deep in another build - I keep convincing myself I need more rods somehow...  Building on a spey blank that is burgundy in colour -    I've built almost all my rods on blank or graphite, much easier colours to match up with hardware and thread. I was thinking garnet or a golden colour for the wraps on this one. Any suggestions?  FYI the hardware is entirely a gunmetal/titanium colour.  Cheers,
Go garnet Kemper, no CP and perhaps silver metallic trim.
Don't listen to Spiel!!! Go chartreuse with lavender trim!!!!

Just the guy I was hoping to hear from - confirmed my first thought Spiel, I think garnet is the answer unless someone can come up with something else I haven't thought of.   On second thought...  I did see a float rod with alternating pink and blue wraps - awful looking thing.

That was my uncle, one day hes straight the next day hes gay, so he wanted the best of both worlds, dont bend over on the river if hes on his pink day or you might get a surpise, newbies in neoprenes are his favorite
